thing-type.label: ZMNHSD DIN Rail Dimmer
thing-type.description: DIN Rail Dimmer<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtThis Z-wave module is used for dimming the bulb or to manage the speed of a fan. The module can be controlled either thorough Z-wave network or through the wall switch.</p&gt <p&gtThe module is designed to be mounted inside an electrical cabinet onto DIN rail.</p&gt <p&gtModule measures power consumption of bulb or fan and supports connection of digital temperature sensor. It is designed to act as repeater in order to improve range and stability of Z-wave network.</p&gt <br /&gt<h2&gtInclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gtPress service button S for more than 6 seconds or press push button I five times within 3s (5 times change switch state within 3 seconds) in the first 60 seconds after the module is connected to the power supply</p&gt <br /&gt<h2&gtExclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gtIf service button S is pressed more than 2 and less than 6 seconds (or if push button I is pressed three times within 3s) module is excluded, but configuration parametres are not set to default values.</p&gt <p&gtNote: If the module is included with parameter 5 with value different from default and module reset is done, wait at least 30s before next inclusion</p&gt

parameter.name: config_5_1
parameter.label: 5: Working mode
parameter.description: Module presentation on the user interface.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtWith this parameter it is possible to change the module presentation on the user interface.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_10_2
parameter.label: 10: Activate / deactivate functions ALL ON / ALL OFF
parameter.description: DIN dimmer module responds to commands ALL ON / ALL OFF<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtDIN dimmer module responds to commands ALL ON / ALL OFF that may be sent by the main controller or by other controller belonging to the system. </p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtdefault value 255</li&gt <li&gt255 - ALL ON active, ALL OFF active.</li&gt <li&gt0 - ALL ON is not active, ALL OFF is not active</li&gt <li&gt1 - ALL ON is not active, ALL OFF active</li&gt <li&gt2 - ALL ON active, ALL OFF is not active</li&gt </ul&gt</p&gt

options.option: ALL ON is not active, ALL OFF is not active
ALL ON is not active, ALL OFF active
ALL ON active, ALL OFF is not active
ALL ON active, ALL OFF active

parameter.name: config_11_2
parameter.label: 11: Automatic turning off output after set time
parameter.description: Automatic turning off output after set time<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<ul&gt<li&gt0 - Auto OFF disabled</li&gt <li&gt1 – 32536 = 1 second – 32536 seconds Auto OFF enabled with defined time, step is 1 second.</li&gt </ul&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_12_2
parameter.label: 12: Automatic turning on output after set time
parameter.description: Automatic turning on output after set time<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<ul&gt<li&gt0 - Auto ON disabled</li&gt <li&gt1 – 32536 = 1 second – 32536 seconds Auto ON enabled with defined time, step is 1 second.</li&gt </ul&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_21_1
parameter.label: 21: Enable / Disable Double click function
parameter.description: If Double click function is enabled, double click to maximum dimming power<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtIf Double click function is enabled, a fast double click on the push button will set dimming power at maximum dimming value.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_30_1
parameter.label: 30: Save state of after a power failure
parameter.description: Saving the state of the device after a power failure<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtAvailable configuration parameters:</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtdefault value 0</li&gt <li&gt0 – DIN dimmer module saves its state before power failure (it returns to the last position saved before a power failure).</li&gt <li&gt1 – DIN dimmer module does not save the state after a power failure, it returns to "off" position.</li&gt </ul&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_40_1
parameter.label: 40: Power reporting in watts on power change
parameter.description: Reporting the power in Watts on power change larger then the setpoint<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtSet value means percentage, set value from 0 - 100=0% - 100%. </p&gt <p&gtAvailable configuration parameters:</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtdefault value 5</li&gt <li&gt0 – Reporting Disabled</li&gt <li&gt1 – 100 = 1% - 100% Reporting enabled. Power report is send (push) only when actual power in Watts in real time changes for more than set percentage comparing to previous actual power in Watts, step is 1%.</li&gt </ul&gt<p&gtNOTE: if power changed is less than 1W, the report is not send (pushed), independent of percentage set.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_42_2
parameter.label: 42: Power reporting in Watts by time interval
parameter.description: Power reporting in Watts by time interval according to setpoint<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtSet value means time interval (0 – 32767) in seconds, when power report is send. </p&gt <p&gtAvailable configuration parameters:</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtdefault value 0</li&gt <li&gt0 – reporting disabled</li&gt <li&gt1 – 32767 = 1 second – 32767 seconds. Reporting enabled. Power report is send with time interval set by entered value. Please note, that too fast reporting can cause too much Z-Wave traffic resulting in Z-Wave poor response.</li&gt </ul&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_60_1
parameter.label: 60: Minimum dimming value
parameter.description: Minimum % dimming value of dimmer<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtAvailable configuration parameters:</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtdefault value 1 = 1% (minimum dimming value)</li&gt <li&gt1- 98 = 1% – 98%, step is 1%. Minimum dimming values is set by entered value.</li&gt </ul&gt<p&gtNOTE: The minimum level may not be higher than the maximum level! 1% min. dimming value is defined by Z-Wave multilevel device class.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_61_1
parameter.label: 61: Maximum dimming value
parameter.description: Maximum % dimming value on dimmer<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtAvailable configuration parameters:</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtdefault value 99 = 99% (Maximum dimming value)</li&gt <li&gt2- 99 = 2% – 99%, step is 1%. Maximum dimming values is set by entered value.</li&gt </ul&gt<p&gtNOTE: The maximum level may not be lower than the minimum level! 99% max. dimming value is defined by Z-Wave multilevel device class.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_65_2
parameter.label: 65: Dimming time (soft on/off)
parameter.description: Set value means time of moving the Dimmer between min. and max. dimming<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtSet value means time of moving the Dimmer between min. and max. dimming values by short press of push button I or controlled through UI (BasicSet). Available configuration parameters (data type is 2 Byte DEC): </p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtdefault value 100 = 1s</li&gt <li&gt1 - 255 = 100 mseconds – 25500 mseconds (25,5s), step is 100 mseconds</li&gt </ul&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_66_2
parameter.label: 66: Dimming time when key pressed
parameter.description: Time to moving the Dimmer between min. and max values (in seconds).<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<ul&gt<li&gtdefault value 3 = 3s</li&gt <li&gt1- 255 = 1 second – 255 seconds.</li&gt </ul&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_67_1
parameter.label: 67: Ignore start level
parameter.description: Ignore or respect start level when used together with association group 3<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter is used with association group 3.</p&gt <p&gtA receiving device SHOULD respect the start level if the Ignore Start Level bit is 0. <br /&gtA receiving device MUST ignore the start level if the Ignore Start</p&gt <p&gtLevel bit is 1. Available configuration parameters:</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtdefault value 0 = respect start level</li&gt <li&gt1 = ignore start level</li&gt </ul&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_68_1
parameter.label: 68: Dimming duration
parameter.description: This parameter is used with association group 3.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe Duration field MUST specify the time that the transition should take from the current value to the new target value. A supporting device SHOULD respect the specified Duration value.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_110_2
parameter.label: 110: Temperature sensor offset settings
parameter.description: Temperature sensor offset settings between -10.0 to 10.0 °C<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtSet value is added or subtracted to actual measured value by sensor.</p&gt <p&gtAvailable configuration parameters:</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtdefault value = 32536</li&gt <li&gt32536 = offset is 0.0C</li&gt <li&gt1 – 100 = value from 0.1 °C to 10.0 °C is added to actual measured temperature.</li&gt <li&gt1001 – 1100 = value from -0.1 °C to -10.0 °C is subtracted to actual measured temperature.</li&gt </ul&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_120_1
parameter.label: 120: Digital temperature sensor reporting
parameter.description: Reporting temperature when change is larger than defined by this parameter<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtIf digital temperature sensor is connected, module reports measured temperature on temperature change defined by this parameter.</p&gt <p&gtAvailable configuration parameters:</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtdefault value 5 = 0,5°C change</li&gt <li&gt0 = Reporting disabled</li&gt <li&gt1- 127 = 0,1°C – 12,7°C, step is 0,1°C</li&gt </ul&gt</p&gt
